node.title: 'Bloody hell, you'll cook': After putting the heat on bureaucrats, this family is the first in NT public housing with rooftop solar
node.alt: Norm Frank and his two daughters in their living room
node.description: Turning on the AC in summer often plunges thousands of Indigenous families into the sweltering dark, but Norman Frank's "trailblazing" fight is changing government policy.
node.content:
["Norman Frank Jupurrurla's yard is green and tidy, no easy feat in Tennant Creek's often sweltering dry heat", "In the past 12 months the small town in Central Australia experienced temperatures above\u00a040 degrees on almost 50 days.\u00a0", "Now, the Warumungu community leader and his family are more prepared than ever to face the heat, thanks to his brand new rooftop solar system.\u00a0", "Before that\u00a0he was \"thinking about power all the time\"\u00a0because if they ran consumed too much, it cut out \"and that's dangerous\".", "\"We had\u00a0to be careful,\" he said.", "\"We've got young kids, plus I have medication to stick in the fridge.\"\u00a0", "", "
About 90 per cent of NT public housing tenants experience\u00a0at least one power disconnection a year.\u00a0(ABC Alice Springs: Samantha Jonscher)
", "Mr Frank was once\u00a0one of the\u00a010,000\u00a0mostly Indigenous,\u00a0public housing tenants in the Territory who rely entirely on a pre-paid meter for their electricity.", "Previously, it was structurally impossible to install rooftop solar.\u00a0\u00a0", "But after years of negotiations\u00a0with industry and government, Mr Frank is the first public housing tenant in the NT to make the switch.\u00a0", "\"Keep on shaking the bush,\" he said of dealing with bureaucracy.", "", "
Mr Frank needs to keep some of his medication in the fridge.\u00a0\u00a0(ABC Alice Springs: Samantha Jonscher)
", "
Power insecurity out bush
", "Under the pre-paid system, users purchase power cards to power their homes\u00a0and if they run out of credit, the power cuts out until the system is recharged.\u00a0", "According to new ANU research authored by Mr Frank and others, 90 per cent of public housing residents temporarily lose power every year because they run out of credit.", "About 75 per cent of tenants\u00a0have it happen more than 10 times a year, for\u00a0hours at a time, sometimes overnight.\u00a0", "Mr Frank said it was manageable if power\u00a0went off at night because \"you go sleep outside, in the breeze\" but if it cut\u00a0out during the day, \"Oh bloody hell, you'll cook. It's really hot\".", "Thanks to Mr Frank's rooftop solar, the energy insecurity of power cards are almost a thing of the past for the family of seven.\u00a0", "Two thirds of Mr Frank's electricity now comes from solar.\u00a0", "
Dangerous power cuts in high temperatures
", "Alice Springs doctor and ANU researcher Simon Quilty has worked in the Territory for more than 20 years\u00a0and knows firsthand what high temperatures do to the body, and what it means for tenants of public housing.", "\"A lot of houses aren't even insulated in the most simple of ways\u00a0and they are extremely overcrowded,\" he said.\u00a0", "\"These houses are highly reliant on electricity to keep them cool, so if the electricity runs out, it's the same as a car parked in a hot car park in\u00a0summer.", "", "
Dr Simon Quilty in his solar-powered home.\u00a0(ABC Alice Springs: Samantha Jonscher)
", "Dr Quilty said temperatures above 40 were dangerous for anyone\u00a0because proteins\u00a0in the body \"literally start\u00a0to cook,\" and anyone unable to shelter from that heat, say because, they'd lost\u00a0power at home, would be \"in serious trouble.\"", "For older people,\u00a0dialysis patients like Mr Frank and people with other underlying health conditions, Dr Quilty said these temperatures, mixed with power cuts, were extremely dangerous.\u00a0", "\"Houses disconnect in Central Australia every fourth day, but in very hot weather every third day for on average around about 10 hours a day,\" he said.", "\"When the power runs out, you are often left in circumstances where you have to decide between buying food and powering up your house.", "", "
Mr Frank says he can now afford to keep his home cool all summer long.(ABC Alice Springs: Samantha Jonscher)
", "Dr Quilty said the situation was \"unfair\".", "\"My house in Alice Springs is covered in solar panels,\" he said.", "\"I pay almost no energy bills\u00a0but no Aboriginal people are given access to that energy security.\"\u00a0", "
Eat, or stay cool?\u00a0
", "It's a decision Tennant Creek deputy mayor and traditional owner Diane Stokes knows all too well.\u00a0", "\"'If you\u00a0have a fridge or freezer or stove on, or air conditioner\u00a0on, it's taking too much power, and you have to choose,\" she said.\u00a0", "", "
Deputy Mayor Diane Stokes at her property on the edge of Tennant Creek.\u00a0(ABC Alice Springs: Samantha Jonscher)
", "At her own property on\u00a0the edge of town, she doesn't have reliable electricity either, and stores her fresh food in coolers with ice.\u00a0", "\"The ice melts because it's very hot.\u00a0Sometimes it gets close to 50 degrees here,\" she said.\u00a0", "Ms Stokes said she was excited to hear that Mr Frank had been successful and called on the government to roll out solar across the NT \"to help with climate change\" and \"to help Aboriginal families\".", "
A light on the horizon\u00a0
", "Mr Frank's solar panels were paid for by Original Power,\u00a0a community development organisation that hopes to include First Nations Australians in the clean energy movement.\u00a0", "", "
Lauren Mellor from the Original Power Network.\u00a0(ABC Alice Springs: Samantha Jonscher)
", "Lauren Mellor from Original Power used Mr Frank's house as a case study to understand \"what\u00a0barriers were preventing Indigenous households and communities\u00a0from accessing solar, like other Territorians\".", "She found quite a few.\u00a0", "Ms Mellor said Power and Water corporation and Jacana Energy didn't have systems in place to allow pre-paid users to access rooftop solar.\u00a0", "But\u00a0after months of trial, error, research and negotiations, they got there.", "\"The journey here has been a long one,\" she said.\u00a0", "
Trailblazer
", "The NT's Minister of Indigenous Essential Services, Chansey Paech, called Norm a \"trailblazer\" and said he \"had opened the door\" for other residents in the NT to access rooftop solar.\u00a0", "", "
Norm Frank and his family are one of 10,000 public housing tenants in the NT who use a pre-paid meter to access electricity.\u00a0\u00a0(ABC Alice Springs: Samantha Jonscher)
", "\"And most importantly, he sends a strong message that\u00a0Aboriginal people are very conscious about their energy use\u00a0and about global warming and climate change,\" Mr Paech said.", "Mr Paech said the NT government was in talks with regional councils and land councils to understand how rooftop solar could be rolled out more widely.\u00a0", "He did not commit to any targets.\u00a0"]
